orthographytooltip:
1) Use Francis-Smith or Listuguj Orthography.
2) If you cannot type ɨ, type * instead.
entryprompt: Enter verbs as they are for nekm, e.g. teluisit:
helpfield:
Check to see if your entered verb matches a pattern of those below.

Currently supported verb patterns:
  • Conjugation 1, Models teluisit, pejila'sit, pekisink, wele'k, wekayk, maqatkwik
  • Conjugation 2, Models amalkat, ajipuna't, pesaq
  • Conjugation 3, Models ewi'kiket, eliet, teluet, teweket, te'sipunqek
  • Conjugation 4, Models nestɨk, ewi'kɨk, nenk, telte'k, ketkwi'k, pewa'q, eyk, telamu'k
  • Conjugation 5, Models mena'toq, ketuk
  • Conjugation 6, Models kesalatl, nemiatl, pesa'tl
  • Conjugation 7, Models kisituatl

The conjugator does not account for dialectal differences in conjugation patterns.
All forms listed may not be in use for every verb.
The conjugator may not always be 100% correct.
sourcefield:
• Francis & Hewson 1994, The Mi'kmaw Grammar of Father Pacifique
  • Dr. Stephanie Inglis' Doctoral Dissertation, 2002
  • Dr. Dianne Friesen's Doctoral Dissertation, 2022
elietdisclaimer: Verbs in -iet take two forms in the dual: one form for travelling by land (e.g. -a'tikw), and one form for travelling by water (e.g. -ieyikw).
nestikdisclaimer: Verbs of the fourth conjugation can have two forms for nekmow: one form in -kik like regular third person plurals, and one form in -mi'tij that resembles the when-conjunct. The form that resembles the when-conjunct is in more frequent use.
nenkdisclaimer: Some verbs that are detected in this group only have inanimate conjugations. For these, only look at the inanimate subject forms. Examples of these verbs are kelulk, nipk, etc.
pewaqdisclaimer: Some verbs in this conjugation are really conjugation 2 verbs with inanimate subjects only. For these, only look at the inanimate subject forms. Examples of these verbs are toqwa'q, wejkwapa'q, etc.
pesatldisclaimer: These verbs fall in two categories that cannot be separated by the nekm form alone. Some have stems in -a-, others in -e-. If you know whether the ni'n form ends in -a'q or -e'k, you can know what pattern the verb follows. The -a- stems are listed first, followed by the -e- stems. If the form is the same for both stems, only one form is listed.
ketukdisclaimer: Some verbs in this conjugation only have inanimate subjects, like those in telamu'k but with a short final vowel. For these verbs, look only at the inanimate subject forms listed here.

orthographytooltip:
1) Wi'ke'n Francis-Smith-iktuk kisna Listukujk.
2) Mu wi'kmn ɨ, awna wi'ke'n *.
entryprompt: Wi'ke'n verb stɨke' ewi'kmn ukjit nekm, e.g. teluisit.
helpfield:
Nmitu, verb piskwa'tu'sɨp tla'sik stɨke' na ulaal tett.

Waqjuika'tekemkewey nenk verbl ta'n tel-kaqiaql stɨke:
  • Keknukwatasik 1, Tela'sikl stɨke' teluisit, pejila'sit, pekisink, wele'k, wekayk, maqatkwik
  • Keknukwatasik 2, Tela'sikl stɨke' amalkat, ajipuna't, pesaq
  • Keknukwatasik 3, Tela'sikl stɨke' ewi'kiket, eliet, teluet, teweket, te'sipunqek
  • Keknukwatasik 4, Tela'sikl stɨke' nestɨk, ewi'kɨk, nenk, telte'k, ketkwi'k, pewa'q, eyk, telamu'k
  • Keknukwatasik 5, Tela'sikl stɨke' mena'toq, ketuk
  • Keknukwatasik 6, Tela'sikl stɨke' kesalatl, nemiatl, pesa'tl
  • Keknukwatasik 7, Tela'sik stɨke' kisituatl

Waqjuika'tekemkewey mu nennuk, ta'n tel-pilui-tluekl verbl dialectl-iktuk.
Msɨt verb-forml mu e'wasinukl ukjit msɨt verbl.
Koqoey teluet waqjuika'tekemkewey etukjel apjiw mu telianuk.
sourcefield:
• Francis & Hewson 1994, The Mi'kmaw Grammar of Father Pacifique
  • Dr. Stephanie Inglis' Doctoral Dissertation, 2002
  • Dr. Dianne Friesen's Doctoral Dissertation, 2022
elietdisclaimer: Verbl tel-kaqiaql -iet pilui-tla'sikl ta'n tujiw tapusijik mimajuinu'k elukwejik: e.g. -a'tikw teluen ta'n tujiw ela'tikw maqamikek, aqq -ieyikw teluen ta'n tujiw elieyikw samqwan-iktuk.
nestikdisclaimer: Verbl keknukwatasik 4-iktuk tapunemi'kl tel-tla'sikl ukjit nekmow: newte'k na -kik stɨke ktɨkl verbl ukjit nekmow, aqq ktɨk na -mi'tij stɨke 'ta'n tujiw teliaj' ukjit nekmow. Ula tela'sik stɨke na 'ta'n tujiw teliaj' teluemk me' kaqi'sk.
nenkdisclaimer: Alt verbl tett waqjuikasikl pasɨk ukjit ula, ula'l, etc.. Pasɨk weketu forml ukjit ula, ulaal, etc. ukjit ulaal verbl. Alt ulaal verbl na kelulk, nipk, etc.
pewaqdisclaimer: Alt verbl tett waqjuikasikl stɨke keknukwatasik 2, aqq pasɨk ukjit ula, ula'l, etc.. Pasɨk weketu forml ukjit ula, ulaal, etc. ukjit ulaal verbl. Alt ulaal verbl na toqwa'q, wejkwapa'q, etc.
pesatldisclaimer: Ulaal verbl tela'sikl tapunemi'kl, aqq ta'n tel-tla'sik verb mu kejitɨmmɨk pasɨk ukjit nekm. Alt tela'sikl -a-, ktɨkl tela'sikl -e-. Kjitu'n ta'n tel-kaqiaq form ukjit ni'n, tel-kaqiaq -a'q kisna -e'k, kis-kjittes ta'n tel-tla'sik verb. Forml ukjit -a- na amskwesewe'l, aqq forml ukjit -e- na tapuewe'l. Ta'n tujiw form ukjit kitk na wijey, pasɨk ula form ewi'kasitew.
ketukdisclaimer: Alt verbl tett waqjuikasikl pasɨk ukjit ula, ula'l, etc., stɨke telamu'k, katu vowel kiaspiaq na toqwaqji'jk. Pasɨk weketu forml ukjit ula, ulaal, etc. ukjit ulaal verbl.
